website_summaries.verdict: The TP-Link Archer AX6000 is an 802.11ax router that delivers relatively fast throughput speeds and packs a lot of tech into its sizable frame. Just note that it's not yet Wi-Fi 6 certified.
pros: Solid parental controls and malware protection

customer_reviews.title: Check the version if you want Guest Wifi
customer_reviews.text: Nice router but BEWARE. If you want the 'Guest Network' functionality be certain that you're getting either version 5 or 6 of the router. Version 4 does NOT do guest wifi. Don't just rely on the advert. Get in touch with the retailer. The version number is on the retail box. (That info is from my experience - I had to return a version 4, and from TP-Link support desk.)
customer_reviews.author: Dinosaurous

customer_reviews.title: New life for our Virgin SuperHub
customer_reviews.text: I have a (2nd Gen) Virgin SuperHub, and although I was using extenders, just wasn't cutting the mustard in terms of range/throughput. I bought this router out of desperation, put my Virgin SuperHub into Modem Only Mode, and wow....I now don't need range extenders and running a WiFi network on two frequencies at the same time (2.4 & 5 Ghz). My SmartTV, which would frequently choke on starting OnDemand programs (usually from iPlayer) is now smooth as butter. Everything is more snappy and fast, and this product gets the thumbs up from my wife who is normally unfazed by technical things. Very impressed!
customer_reviews.author: BugPowderDust

customer_reviews.title: Massive improvement
customer_reviews.text: Purchased AC1200 Archer C6 to replace the wifi function of the awful Virgin supa hub 3. Wow! What a massive improvement, brilliant strong wifi signal and the wired gigabit router is faultless. I will update at a later date if there are issues, but for now, it's a big YES from me. Update. I purchased a second one to use as an access point in the mancave. All is working superbly! Tip. Turn mimo on. Turn Qos off if you want full speed everywhere, on if internet fluctuates too much and if using more than one make sure ssid and password is the same on both.
customer_reviews.author: Riccardo C

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly on sky fibre UK
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from Archer VR200 to the AX6000, I have sky fibre which uses mer option 60/61 when authenticating, connect wan port to a modem or VDSL router which connects to sky fibre, disable WiFi on Sky fibre connected device and set dmz to IP assigned to wan port on ax6000, I can not praise this router enough, it’s super fast, responsive and handles all smart devices, no network lag and has killed all my dead spots, streaming is now perfect for many devices. Alexa enabled and ifttt is brilliant, I highly recommended this, also tp link support is outstanding with 24hr response to technical questions if they can’t solve straight away.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: the coverage has substantially improved even in the furthest part of the house I can get a good connection and in the same room of the router
customer_reviews.text: This router has greatly improved my wi-fi capabilities since installation over a week ago co I have not had a single drop out. Also, the coverage has substantially improved even in the furthest part of the house I can get a good connection and in the same room of the router, I am getting a faster connection than I am paying for. I find this easy to recommend.
customer_reviews.author: DavidElis

customer_reviews.title: Buy now better then mesh or boosters, worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing couldn’t recommend enough. I have 200mbps virgin internet. And I was getting 16-30 mbps in most of the other rooms. We have a bout 15 devices used a lot and at the same times. Now it’s 200+ mbps in every single room and doesn’t drop out or miss a beat from doing multiple tests at different times of the day and with usage high or low from devices connected to Wi-Fi. The easiest set up I’ve ever come across but it now don’t bother with mesh systems or boosters get this and you won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: louis larder

customer_reviews.title: TP-Link Archer AX11000 Flagship without support
customer_reviews.text: TP Link has a deep respect for its customers when you buy their product. Then he has his clients somewhere !!! Additionally, it uses false advertising "WPA3" and "OFDMA" they do not exist. He misleads and cheats by promising everything. Lack of many features in the software, in one word BETA test. Daily reset and wifi issues.
customer_reviews.author: L SOLAWA

customer_reviews.title: Would rcertainly recommend this one.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Bought it to upgrade the unreliable Virgin Hub 3.0. Example, Pc which is 11 feet from the hub 390mbps, tv which is 6.5 feet from the hub 130 mbps. At least they were for an hour till I checked them again and the figures were up and down like a pair of prostitutes knickers. Now at least they are higher now but constant. My only niggle is that I wish it was a bit heavier so it didn't move about so easy. Apart from that it's easy to set up and control with your phone. Still an excellent router.
customer_reviews.author: Sirius

customer_reviews.title: Decent bit of kit, but let down by the signal strength!
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps my expectations for this router were too high, but at this price I expected better signal range. The device itself was much smaller than I expected, and was so easy to set up (in the usual TP-Link manner). The UI has some really nice options like turning the LEDs off at night. The biggest issue I had was that the range just wasn’t all that, and even though I was replacing a Virgin SuperHub 3 the range was about the same (given the Archer was slightly quicker though). Anyone familiar with the SuperHub 3 knows it’s really really bad, and isn’t a great benchmark. I ended up returning the device and spending a bit more on a mesh device.
customer_reviews.author: Tarzan

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Once finished set up, it only worked when connected to it by an Ethernet cable. However, trying to use any wireless device and it would not accept the correct password, even after re-set up and reboots etc. So I could never really use its wireless facility. Plus, apparently, based on the indicator bars, its wifi range is no better than my existing router's, although for extending the range is what I bought it for. I called the customer service hotline but it was in somewhere China and the person there just did not have an understanding of how to fix this issue apart from re-set up etc. I am returning it. very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: T. Papp

customer_reviews.title: Best 5ghz VPN router in its range
customer_reviews.text: Router is excellent for VPN. The Signal is brilliant around the whole house. Its been in VPN mode since November 2019 every day 24 hours. Not once given a problem. Only thing is don't update to any latest update. The new update don't like the protocols from my VPN provider. So I reverted back to the old software that came with it and works a charm. I only use 5ghz and have disabled the 2ghz as the speeds are way to low on 2ghz that even goes for my Virgin box also. Both are on 5ghz. Bargain price on Amazon. Love shopping on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Suhaib hussain

customer_reviews.title: Great for a wired access point!
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a Wi-Fi access point and switch behind the TV to connect the various streaming boxes. Bought this to replace an older TP-Link ADSL router which I had used as this new one has faster Wi-Fi and faster Ethernet ports. Setup was easy and now has a mode for using it like I do, as an access point. Wi-Fi for laptops and phones is now much faster and similarly streaming on the Amazon Fire Stick. Haven't noticed any speed difference on the Ethernet connected devices. Hope it turns out to be as reliable as the old router. I've been impressed with the TP-Link network kit I've bought which provides great value!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Stevens

customer_reviews.title: An excellent home or small office router
customer_reviews.text: My requirements for networking hardware are a little above average so I'm a little wary of products like this, but good reviews all over the internet convinced me to give it a go. The wired performance is excellent with high throughput and no dropped packets, wireless range is great too although I use external access points. It has every feature you could need, and many you probably never will (including a built in bit-torrent client and USB storage/printer support). It has a configurable guest network and bandwidth prioritisation features. Forwarding ports is easy, and the built-in VPN and dynamic DNS features are appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Fast but intermittent 5ghz signal.
customer_reviews.text: While this is fast and works flawlessly on the 2.5ghz band, its 5ghz performance is intermittent at best. Its either very slow of just cuts out. If you Google the issue there are many many owners having the same issue and so far for me none of the fixes have worked. The GUI is fine although could do with a little more explanation for some settings but its flexible in the way you can limit or prioritise aspects of the WiFi. For this money i wanted fast 5G, this unit doesn't supply that on anywhere near a regular basis.
customer_reviews.author: Neil 'Superfly' Guy

customer_reviews.title: The Best Router I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router because the previous DLINK I ordered did not work properly on 2.4gh mode for my security cameras. This Bad boy TPLINK C4000 not only has tri band and security cameras worked perfect but it now cover the entire 4 bedroom 2 story house including right to the back of my back garden with 4 bars. I have had to use an extender plugged at back of house to get this before. Everything just works great on this. If you have a crappy Virgin 3 not so superhub. Then this is what you want. great QOS, security and family controls as standard. Best purchase of 2020 thank you TPLINK.
customer_reviews.author: Tudanski

customer_reviews.title: Stable and good Wifi signal strength
customer_reviews.text: Bought to upgrade a home Wifi Switch (an old triple-aerial DLink) hanging off a home router. I'm not using DHCP on it or the WAN/Cable connection - both are handled by the seperate router. It's basically acting as a Wifi repeater and 4-port wired switch (for my TV, set top boxes and games consoles etc) The TP-Link model was very easy to install as a Layer 2 Wifi switch (via its "access point mode" setting) Wifi speeds are extremely fast when sitting in the same room as the router and the signal coverage throughout the house is noticably better and more stable than the old DLink. Really can't fault it at all so far.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Out of this world!
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded to Tp-link AX11000 after being drowned in bugs and drop-outs from my supposedly superb Nighthawk AX8. The TP link has truly done the job. I have done away with an Access Point router as this router blasts the whole house with WiFiand beyond. I'm a smart home gadget person and streamer with wireless IP cameras and have a gamer in the house. The router handles everything with ease. Took a little getting used to the admin setup for port forwarding etc but that's just because I'm used to Netgear. This thing does exactly what it says.... I am now a Tp-link convert!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. J. Ashworth

customer_reviews.title: Purchased as a replacement for a Netgear Nighthawk RAX80
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a replacement for the unstable Netgear RAX80; only had it a week so early days but thus far it has outperformed the Netgear on every level. I use it as an Access Point (internet comes in via another device). All devices stay connected (over 30 of them, TVs, Smart Heating, Smart Lighting, Smart Plugs, Smart Phones, Tablets, PCs, Laptops, CCTV, Alarms, Dyson Robot Vac...etc). WiFi speeds are very good although given the size of the router and the number of antennas I was hoping it would reach the far corners of the house a little better but overall, excellent router all. I'm very pleased with it and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Craig & the Mrs

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to improve wi-fi in my home after getting fed-up with having to reboot my Virgin Media Superhub 3 almost every day. I live in an old house with thick walls, and surrounded by neighbours with wi-fi. The Virgin hub was in a front corner of my house, the connection was patchy, slow and kept cutting out. This was easy to set up and at a good price. It's been connected for nearly 2 weeks and the connection is still good all over the house and hasn't dropped out once.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great for medium wifi environment!! Better than virgin 2.0
customer_reviews.text: For the money this is an banging little router!!!!! Eats the virgin media super 2 router for a meal.... hands down.... Simple easy to connect and setup.. value for money!! Sat at the back of my garden with a provided speed test giving me more a very good connection as shown in the picture, wired connection great certianly took the load off that old virgin router. Giving you better laitency and overall network load distributiin!!! Great for streaming and gaming.. if planning on getting a network switch with simlar features to further increase wired efficiency while using my the router as a access point go for it! You won't be disappointed with buffer issues either way !!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Massive upgrade to BT standard equipment.
customer_reviews.text: Coverage is excellent. (1450 sq ft Semi Detached 2 Storey Property). Currently have 11 devices connected to both 2.4 and 5ghz WiFi and consistently achieving 200+ mobs on BT FTTH product. No drops in connection or stuttering on WiFi streaming and we have a Fire Stick 4k in four separate rooms on top of Laptops, Smart Phones and Wi-fi enabled devices. User interface is simple to use from the Tp Link App. Overall I'm absolutely delighted with the Router and glad I went for an AX Router which will keep it future proofed for a few years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. J. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Probably cheapest for this classs
customer_reviews.text: Router is very good, setup very easy through an app on the phone, works out of the box with an update. For the price this is probably the best there is. My flat is about 55 meter square at 5Ghz it still reach everywhere with a little drop off in other rooms. You can select each items on which band width with the app. The only down side is the look and the size of it, wish it is more compact and better looking.
customer_reviews.author: popkid

customer_reviews.title: Complete Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: So they tell you that Wi-Fi 6 is a game changer. It’s true! I’m sitting in my living room the TP Link access point is in the room above - I’m using a VPN on my iPhone 11 (a WiFi 6 client) and getting 110mbps. My son upgraded his desktop wireless card to WiFi 6 and is also getting over 100 mbps in the storey above the access point. If you are with Virgin Media and you buy over 100 mbps you will be amazed. Finally wireless catches up with power line adapters
customer_reviews.author: J. Azopardi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent replacement for a virgin Superhub
customer_reviews.text: Bought this based on other reviews here to replace my Virgin Superhub-2 as primary Wifi device. I was not disappointed. Setup was super easy, moving all the cables across and then enabling modem mode on my virgin hub. I downloaded the TP tether app which walked me through the rest of the setup process and everything was up and running inside 10 minutes. Alot of our devices used to loose Wifi at least once on hour with the virgin hub, so far with this TP Router we have had zero loss of signal and both speed and range has increased across both bands.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Warren

customer_reviews.title: Runs great pairing with Virgin Media Superhub's (Modem Mode)
customer_reviews.text: Running this on a Virgin Media Superhub on Modem Mode. Purchased due to Superhub dropping out when all of us are connected (replaced the Superhub multiple times with no luck) Haven't stumbled into any issues as of yet and I've paired this with the TP-Link RE300 AC1200, a Wifi Repeater which has OneMesh technology which this router also uses to extend the range without using any extra SSIDs and has been working great, the range has been more than acceptable reaching to each part of the house. For the price you pay for, you get a seriously stable product with no issues!
customer_reviews.author: Klive

customer_reviews.title: Terrible speeds wirelessly!
customer_reviews.text: I've included a wired and wireless comparison, both tests taken simultaneously from the router to my PC. There is no walls seperating my router and my computer and I am on the 5ghz band with 3 bars on my PC. This router should easily meet 500mbs wirelessly and yet here we are with a measley 30mbs vs 500mbs wired. This router simply sucks wirelessly. I don't know if I have a faulty router or what, but this is not what I was expecting from a £70 router...
customer_reviews.author: Tom C

customer_reviews.title: Rock Solid WiFi.
customer_reviews.text: Our sky router has been replaced twice and needed relocating to get half decent broadband speeds. That left half our house without good wifi. The addition of a new bit of hardware that needed a 5ghz network meant I bought this. I've set it up so that it is the only wifi in the house and the sky routers deals with ip addresses and broardband only. and our internet has never been better. 2.4 and 5gig networks both stable and reliable. no more turning off and on to reset everything! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mr / Mrs Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Overall a really strong router, easy to setup and I get much better reception in the nooks and crannies of the house. Very consistent WiFi speeds and most importantly, it's able to handle all my WiFi connected devices which the Virgin media started to struggle with. Only downside, and I think it's more Virgin media hub 3 router mode, is that I'm not getting stronger than 200mb signal even though I'm on 350mb. But in saying that, I'm constantly getting 200mb where with hub3 it was fluctuating like crazy thought the day.
customer_reviews.author: GVJ

customer_reviews.title: Save your money, and buy something else
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if I have a duff router, but this is the worst Wireless Router I have ever had the pleasure of soending a day and a half of my life trying to get to work. I have to admit that the set up is a breeze and the mobile application is excellent. This is only let down by the poor quality of the Router. Like I said it may be this unit, but it's the most unstable Router I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Adam H-M

customer_reviews.title: Not the cheapest, but extremely good value.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for a really poor Sky router. We’d previously has BT broadband and their homehub6 router provided great coverage throughout our modest 4-bed house. This does the job prefectly BUT YOU STILL NEED THE SKY MODEM. I paid £70-ish delivered and, tbh, it’s worth it to get a really good, strong wifi signal wherever we need it. It took approximately 2 mins to install and since then it’s worked faultlessly. I’m a big believer in the adage “it’s not cheap when you pay twice”. This was not the cheapest item on offer, but it’s absolutely done the job, 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Keith L

customer_reviews.title: Slow but waterproof
customer_reviews.text: In my experience so far I can't say that the wifi is any faster than the BT Smart Hub it replaced. It's possibly slower but it's early days yet. Haven't tried it wired yet. The management interface is fine and easy to use and understand. I left a window open, it poured down and the Archer got a pretty good soaking and stopped working. Left to dry out for a couple of days and it's up and running again without fault. Lucky me.
customer_reviews.author: murray451

customer_reviews.title: Great value router
customer_reviews.text: Cannot fault this router for the price. The wireless signal and performance wipes the floor with virgin media's superhub 3. Everytime I set the superhub to 886mbs, it would cause the router to crash. The tp link is setup to give 886 out of the box and works brilliantly with no issues. I now have 2.4/5ghz in every corner of my property, with near enough full 110mb download, where all other previous routers have struggled to reach!
customer_reviews.author: Chris L

customer_reviews.title: Plugged in and works - Setup easy from tether app
customer_reviews.text: TP-Link Archer C6 AC1200 - Setup was easy with Tether app but from computer it was a little more complicated. The instructions assume that you are using it as the main router but when it is an access point, extending an existing network, it gets a different IP address. Once the tether app showed me what that was, I could configure from the app or the browser interface. Works fine - getting perfect signal and 200 mbs to internet which is limited by the broadband supplier.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Allen

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Router
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this so I could use my Virgin Hub 3 in modem mode and this as router because the hubs features and parental controls sucked. Wow I didn't realize how bad the hub 3 wifi is until I hooked up this. I could always get 210 mbps on my pc hard wired to the hub 3 via Ethernet and around 65 mbps on my phone via wifi. After I hooked this up my pc gets 240 mbps and my phone gets a shocking 220 mbps via wifi and thats an amazing difference. Also parental controls are great. I love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Webby

customer_reviews.title: Buy a different manufacturer's product.
customer_reviews.text: This router is great, as long as you don't want to use it very much. After prolonged usage (such as streaming a film) the router packs in and requires power cycling. I've spoken to TP link support and they have not been able to provide any assistance, they suggest fixes I've already tried, that require me to disconnect to try them again. I've had similar problems with my TP Link Archer C6. My advice to you is choose a different manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Tidy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent budget wifi router
customer_reviews.text: I needed an extra wifi router for the living room as the BT Hub 6 is quite horrible and the wifi signal kept dropping. After installing this one my online experience improved dramatically. It's really plug-and-play, but it can be setup to specific needs. I only did basic config stuff like changing the default access point name. It comes with an internal healthcheck to the internet router that restarts it if it has lost connectivity. I'd like it to have gigabit ethernet, but I can live with 100Mb at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: Nikos

customer_reviews.title: Great Budget Router with strong Wifi
customer_reviews.text: Good budget router for Cable broadband or those with a separate ADSL modem. Standard TP-Link Interface with all the usual basic options for Wireless Network setup. Wifi performace is above average for a unit in this class, the 3 antenna diversity probably helps with this. My application for this was to provide a network segment with wifi for a small warehouse, and it was absolutely perfect for this application.
customer_reviews.author: djpete

customer_reviews.title: Simple to set up, nice and powerful wifi
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace the Virgin Media "Super" Hub 3. It was super easy to set up, almost plug and play - with the interface guiding you through the set up. Wifi is much much better than the Virgin Sh3. Since using this I've no complaints from my teenage daughters about wifi stopping ( this automatically got this router 5 stars). Def recommend.
customer_reviews.author: tkp

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for 15 months and failed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product and set it up as an Access Point to provide extended network coverage to IP enabled electronics at the back of my house (desktop PC, tablets etc). It worked absolutely fine for 15 months but over the last month it started to drop connections regularly. It no longer communicates at all with my main hub (supplied by my home internet provider) so it's defective. As I'm an electronics engineer I'm fairly proficient with computer networks and it is definitely the hardware. Even restored to factory setup and re-installed. I've temporarily replaced it with a 4-way ethernet switch, but that is non-wireless, so I will have to buy another Access Point. That's life I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: Rob W

customer_reviews.title: Much better than sky hub
customer_reviews.text: Replaced sky hub wifi and it’s amazing. Decent speeds on 2.4 ghz At mich better range inc upstairs and in backyard, and 5. 5ghz is amazing, went from 35 Mbps to over 70 Mbps! I’d purchase again just to have control over listing the 5ghz network separately. Setup was easy: 1. Connect via ip 2. Follow wizard 3. Plug sky hub in 4. Reconnect via ip and setup rest of settings 5. Disable wifi on sky hub
customer_reviews.author: Ian Broom

customer_reviews.title: A Decent 5Ghz AC Wireless router
customer_reviews.text: If you've configured a TP-Link router before then you will be able to configure this. It has one or two extra bits but still the same. You get the full 833Mb/s bandwidth of 5Gz. Funnily enough on the 2.4Ghz band it is technically a little slower than my previous router. But bottom line is that this is a very good 5Ghz AC wireless router.
customer_reviews.author: Only me

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother. It repeatedly crashes
customer_reviews.text: Utterly useless, drops out connection to the FTTH box seemingly at random when prior ‘Lower spec’ router worked just fine. Bought as an upgrade utterly disappointed in the lack of a reliable connection and it is most defiantly this hardware as I’ve done a A-B-A check swapping old and new routers over and sadly the Archer C6 isn’t upto the task.
customer_reviews.author: Smoke me a kipper

customer_reviews.title: Not wat i was expecting..
customer_reviews.text: I liked the design it looks great, I dont have any wifi 6 devices yet but with iphone 6s it has issue with speed and coverage.. also it was hotter than my other router hence I decided to keep my tplink c6 & return this..
customer_reviews.author: Sanj

customer_reviews.title: It does work, but it's disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Signal distance is poor. Only about 3 meters in the same room with no obstructions. The Router Management page is basic, offering your standard Static IP management. The VPN DOES NOT offer OpenVPN. There is no Tomato or DD-WRT firmware for this router. But this is extremely cheap for a router. It does work, but it's disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Little Grebs

customer_reviews.title: Good router
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my Virgin Media Hub and instead used it as a second router. I have had no problems with it and its nice to have individual 2.4ghz and 5ghz options - I use the 2.4ghz for the Guest network. The only negative point I can find is you cannot install a VPN on the router - this would have been nice but overall I would recommend this router
customer_reviews.author: GuitarMan

customer_reviews.title: Parental çontrol reliable
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good router very easy to setup despite not having Bluetooth. If you need a stable fast and reliable router this is just the ticket. I purchased for parent control function and was blown away with the capabilities, my advise don't buy any other product this is a real deal. I purchased Linksys and Netgear router but their parent control required a subscription to circle and the other was unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: deemac

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the virgin superhub, what a piece of rubbish that is. This router is brilliant, download the app and follow instructions and was up and running within minutes. You can do loads with the app as well, like see who is connected, prioritise certain equipment and even pause Internet for the kids (even have it set up on a timer)
customer_reviews.author: noel

customer_reviews.title: Powerline hotspot
customer_reviews.text: I have a mancave at the bottom of my garden, I have always used a powerline to get internet but I could only plug on device in via ethernet. No no wifi signal and only one device. I had thought about getting another router but I was concerned there would be to much formatting etc as a work around, however this has worked great and literally plug and play. I've now got my pc, laptop and games console all wired via ethernet and I also have my own wifi connection all running at 60 mbps (my internet is 350). Fantastic product has really helped me working from home.
customer_reviews.author: Sjollema

customer_reviews.title: Rubbish
customer_reviews.text: Instructions were followed exactly,the router did what it should do except connect to the internet.Went into help and told to make sure I had a internet connection and all cables were connected.Tried everything I could think of for a long time and finally gave up and re-connected my old TP-Link which worked fine. Not very happy,will have to get a computer geek to have a go,or it goes back to Amazon. John,Turre,Spain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Could not et it to work
customer_reviews.text: I have an existing Belkin router which is quite old and when it seemed to losing coverage with wifi it was suggested to me that perhaops I should invest in a replacement Unfortnately after several hours of frustrating effort I decided thatthis router was faulty so it will be returned .Easy setup??
customer_reviews.author: K. Overton

customer_reviews.title: Annoying device limit
customer_reviews.text: Having a house full of nest and ring cams all running off my BT hub, I decided to buy a separate router to run them so I could switch them off easily if I wanted to watch some UHD over the internet. Annoyingly, this router has a limit to how many connected devices it can support at any one time. This means my camera’s are forever dropping out now. Think this will be returned as it is not fit for purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive router that delivers
customer_reviews.text: This is a really inexpensive router that just works really well. I use this one as an extension to my network as the wifi signal from the main router upstairs doesn't get to downstairs very well. I use a powerline adapter to plug this TP-Link in downstairs and provide a good wifi signal. This was much easier to setup than a previous router as it did have a specific option for extending the network (I'd previously had to use two different subnets)
customer_reviews.author: CurryKitten

customer_reviews.title: A great router when updated to the latest firmware.
customer_reviews.text: When I first purchased this item, I was having initial issues with it constantly rebooting. It was getting really hot and I believe the thermal limits were set too low. After a firmware update to the latest version, it's been super smooth with no more rebooting and running really smoothly. Wifi network is stable and incredibly quick on Wifi 6. The router itself is very small and compact, initial setup was easy, and I haven't needed to tweak any of the settings since the firmware upgrade. It's a shame I had those initial issues on first arrival as it was almost a instant return for me. However now, I'm really happy with it and it's been great to use.
customer_reviews.author: Mem

customer_reviews.title: European plug and you also need a modem
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with this product. I bought it to replace an existing TP Link Router and am not particularly tech savvy. I had no idea that I would need a modem as well as I assumed it was like my exisiting TP Link one that had a modem and router all in one. Anyway, after quite a while trying to get it to work I finally realised the problem. Not happy. Also, it came with an european plug and no adaptor. I had expected a British plug.
customer_reviews.author: PL

customer_reviews.title: Archer C6 AC1200 Perfect for a Smart Flat
customer_reviews.text: I was very frustrated with my old router which was provided by my internet service provider but then I bought the TP Link Archer C6 AC1200. I was a bit skeptical if it would do the job but it has worked extremely well far beyond my expectations. I have got 20 devices in total running in my 550 square foot flat on both bands (2.4Ghz and 5Ghz) and there are no blind spots and I have a 50 Mbps connection internet connection and the speeds I am getting on the Wifi is almost 48-49 Mbps. Previously I did not get more than 30-35 Mbps. Excellent router for the price, would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Nice and powerful router with WIFI 6 capability
customer_reviews.text: TP-Link Archer AX6000 Router is a nice router with latest WIFI 6 technology. I have been using this router for more than 2 months now and since I installed, I haven’t seen any network failure, slow speed or connectivity issues while accessing my internet from range of devices I have. I have couple of smart devices as well and they are working quite seamlessly. In fact by Sonos speaker which is on 2.4 GHz band is always connected to this router without any lags or connection issues. Really impressed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nitin

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and simple to set up
customer_reviews.text: Set up as an AP works a right treat. Have tried all sorts of Mash, power line through my 300 year old house and nothing worked well. Now have 2 x powerful routers at each end of the house, this tp link in Access point mode worked perfectly. Also bonus to switch WiFi off in the evening when we sleep
customer_reviews.author: The Robinsons

customer_reviews.title: TP-Link AC1750
customer_reviews.text: Looks there are two versions of "TP-Link AC1750", the one I received is clearly not the one advertised. Main complains: Just one USB port instead of two. 100Mbps LAN ports instead of gigabit!!! No improvement to the WIFI coverage over the VM Superhub 2. Very disappointed, going straight back.
customer_reviews.author: J.W.

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and Fast
customer_reviews.text: We ordered two Netgear routers. One failed in 16 days the other kept locking up. Both were returned. These boxes have been working in access point mode for weeks and the cries of 'Dad the internet isn't working' are consigned to the past. They are connected to a BT Home hub 2 and no problems. Our Hive heating system control is also behaving itself now. Sensitivity is good. Pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Razenby

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Really good router, it's solved all my wifi, throughout and connectivity issues. It's powerful and delivers the service it promises. Worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Scott

customer_reviews.title: Good range, good price
customer_reviews.text: I'm is my this as a direct replacement for a Virgin Superhub 3 (connected in modem mode). In comparison to that device, the signal is a massive improvement. The separate 2.4ghz and 5ghz channels no longer cause issues with my Ring doorbell and the range is greatly improved. Setup was relatively easy with a decent interface and plenty of configurable options. Overall, it's solved the problem I bought it for so I'm happy with it, but it should be suitable for most people with a moderately sized house looking for range improvements over the Superhub.
customer_reviews.author: Tonksy

customer_reviews.title: Good Coverage and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Changed my virgin media router into Modem only mode and then connected to this via network cable, changed all security to what I wanted etc and up and running in 5 mins. Decent wifi coverage in my 1900's (sturdy) house despite thick walls etc. Works almost seamlessly with 4 tplink powerline adaptors the vast majority of the time - the powerline adaptors sometimes lose their home membership until rebooted but nothing to do with this device I don't think. Very good product and good VFM. well worth the investment
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Could of been good. Needs firmware fixing
customer_reviews.text: Promising hardware just a shame the firmware was riddled with bugs. Kept getting kicked off wifi and considering it was wifi6 certain parts of the house didnt get strong signal... directly under modem. I chose to return and get Asus Rog and its definitely done a better job
customer_reviews.author: Mr C

customer_reviews.title: It's ok, trouble roaming though
customer_reviews.text: When roaming back into the room in where this is located and from having no other wifi signal, upon connecting back-up the connection is very sporadic. My virgin superhub 3 had no issues of this whatsoever. Also I found the speed I was getting was poor at times.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Older version better
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router for the second time as I gave mine to my grandad. It's an amazing router, too bad this newer updated version has one less USB port and the it isn't a capable as the older version. My old router was running version 2, I have version 5 and I must say, it is shocking. So many of the features that I wanted just aren't there, I've been using the advanced settings and it's still basic compared to the old version, apart from that key difference (where old is better) this router is an amazing buy and anyone, literally anyone could buy this and use it straight away
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Streete

customer_reviews.title: Not complete
customer_reviews.text: I looked forward to receiving this next day by Prime. It arrived, I unpacked it, and the leads don't fit a UK BT socket. I've just ordered an adapter at extra cost, using Prime, so I'm waiting for tomorrow now before I can set up the router. Silly.
customer_reviews.author: Vik Szendzielarz

customer_reviews.title: Works well as a wifi booster
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately does not work as a stand alone wireless router. No input socket for the phone line so instead I kept the old router and used an ethernet cable to bring the signal to the new TP-Link router. Now I can use my iPad in the garden at a distance of 30m from the house!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher S. Cant

customer_reviews.title: Great coverage
customer_reviews.text: I've got 2 of these, one as the main router and one in access point mode connected via a powerline adapter, same ssid and password on both with different channels so no interference, and it's seemless roaming between them. Very fast download speeds over WiFi and ethernet maxes out my 300mbps connection.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: It works very well and I am pleased
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up and works really well. The Virgin wireless router struggles to cover the house, so I have bought the adapter to use the electrical system as the network, plugged this in and it is working away quite happily. In fact if I stand by the Virgin router, I get the signal from this one, if I stand by the TP-Link router, I don't get the virgin router signal :-) It works very well and I am pleased
customer_reviews.author: Paul J.

customer_reviews.title: Ok for some
customer_reviews.text: I had hoped this router would fix our wifi-signal problems but it made absolutely no difference to signal strength. If you have dead spots in your home, I would get an extender or mesh.
customer_reviews.author: Plum

customer_reviews.title: My saviour from the gastly 3.0 hub from virgin!
customer_reviews.text: Saved me from the gastly smart hub 3.0 (virgin) This product is amazing, great value for money. Really nice user interface and good layout. WiFi is really steady and decent range! Couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: TheHonestBloke

customer_reviews.title: Great bit of kit.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent spec, works flawlessly. Just one thing... if you have the new Virgin Media 1gig service don't set this router to use 2.5Gbps on the WLAN port or it causes issues. Normal 1000 mode is fine. (No doubt the VM modem and the router will get a firmware update to fix this at some point)
customer_reviews.author: D S

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work with Sky
customer_reviews.text: Ordered to replace sky q - awful signal dropping out with it. Read reviews saying it’s easy to sort with sky broadband etc... we’ve tried to get it working for nearly two months. Annoyingly missed the return window so now have a £150 item which doesn’t work. Do not buy if you have sky broadband. Will update review if can get working.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer PH

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend! Superb well functioning wireless router
customer_reviews.text: Super product, used in our theatre to connect a range of technical equipment over 30m distance. Signal is full strength and connection rapid. The setup is really easy too, I was able to name/set password with ease and the router also can act as a signal repeater of which there is a different mode selection). Whilst the build is light and plasticy the unit looks good and fairly solid and as long as it's mounted in a safe place I wouldn't worry about being broken. Great choice, would recommend! Delivery on time and well packaged too. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Scott

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: What I needed was rock solid stability. And that's what I got with this. We have a number of Wifi enabled devices around the house about 15, and two wired networks. I wanted to (re)bridge the wired networks using WIFI. Basically, my office stuff upstairs and the PS4, PS3, Samsung Telly and BT connection downstairs. My old WIFI router was a budget £30 thing and would constantly fall over and need rebooting. This has never needed rebooting. I paired it with a TP-Link N Range Extender upstairs and it's all been good. The TV and PS3 stream media from a Linux server upstairs, the performance is great. This device has been no problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: 3dokid

customer_reviews.title: Great but
customer_reviews.text: Great router the wifi is fast and penetrates thick walls ok, item is large. Omly issue ive had is i was getting 950mb on my router from broadband service. With this im only getting 690. Thats a big drop and i have no idea why
customer_reviews.author: Jwhk

customer_reviews.title: No complaints on TalkTalk fibre.
customer_reviews.text: Very sorry I can't do an educated review of this router - my brother installed it while I was asleep, and I awoke to find that the streams I was recording had gone down >:( Getting my laptops' wifi going again by entering network password was the work of a minute or so, no problem at all. One laptop on the network is 5.0MHz-ready and the improvement is significant and welcome, so I'm going to get new cards or dongles for the others. The router seems lighter than my previous TalkTalk-supplied Huawei HG532, even though it's bigger, but I'm not particularly concerned about build quality as the router won't be handled much and certainly not roughly.
customer_reviews.author: clemenzina

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: Avoid...countless threads about WiFi issues. Firmware upgrade did not solve. Waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Kedongit657

customer_reviews.title: Excelnt as an AP
customer_reviews.text: Great wifi router, I'm using it as an access point, low latency, good stability, long range coverage even through my solid stone walls. havent had to use technical support it works.
customer_reviews.author: John W

customer_reviews.title: It hasn't missed a beat since I got it up and running
customer_reviews.text: I have TalkTalk fibre which has been ok but from time to time it would slow down. On these occasions I would try and connect to router but had trouble doing so. This led me to believe that the problem was the router being unable to handle the load of the various devices that using WiFi in our house. When I saw this router on offer I decided to go for it and haven’t regret it so far, much better than the free TalkTalk router. It did take me a little time to get it working as it didn't automatically detect the correct connection type but once I configured it manually it worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Noz

customer_reviews.title: AC1750
customer_reviews.text: Replaced bt hub 4. Already had the modem that is required for this to work. Was hoping for much better rang however this maybe down to the tech connected to it (Sony Bravia) being rubbish! Certainly gives much better speed test results than old hub 4. Was a bit of a faff to set up resulting in a bit of googling, got there in the end.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: brilliant
customer_reviews.text: thank goodness for this. it takes the strain of 6 differnt desktops, laptops and handheld devices in one go, wen we had a party, no problems.... it was a nightmare before. Plus, it reaches down to the bottom of the garden to where I can relax in my hammock and watch a film very easy to set up
customer_reviews.author: Abi

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and simple to operate. Set up doesnt take very long. Very happy with it. The signal is good but expected it to reach farther with 8 antennas. Would recommend to anyone intending to upgrade from virgin media hub 3 - makes a world of a difference
customer_reviews.author: Damian

customer_reviews.title: Atrocious! Great WHEN it works, but serious issue with connection and rebooting often required!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely atrocious!!! This product is amazing... when it’s working, WHEN! It has great range and transfer speeds, except the fact that it randomly starts dropping the internet from random devices over WiFi and needs rebooting a few times a day to fix it, very very annoying. It seems worse after lots of usage, but can do this randomly at anytime. Firmware updates etc haven’t fixed it, as such I couldn’t recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: casey

customer_reviews.title: Solid router for price
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. It has only one band, and the range isn't fantastic but as good as the Netgear that preceded it. But it works fine, my mam has it and there haven't been issues--I need one that performs solidly as I am not there to maintain it often).
customer_reviews.author: RickOG

customer_reviews.title: Best in its price range
customer_reviews.text: Best for the value. If you want to use it as the center of your network (after the broadband modem from your provider) you’ll loose most of the features but works well on the basics like wireless ap or wired router. Easy to install and configure and seems to be stable
customer_reviews.author: waces

customer_reviews.title: Great easy and so simple
customer_reviews.text: Amazing value and amazing product so easy to set up and use didnt use the easy settings did everything my self and set the hole thing up withing minutes. Got to remember if you get this make sure you dont have the antennas all facing the same way make sure they are all set at different angles that way they dont interfere with each other.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony R.

customer_reviews.title: Not the fastest wifi but has a fantastic range
customer_reviews.text: This gives fantastic range I bought this to replace my virgin media superhub as a budget replacement I didn't wanna spend too much on one so I chose this, yes I know it's not the fastest but it's fast enough and has no trouble running my 4K Amazon fire TV and now TV and all the household iPads and iPhones from it all on Wi-Fi at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup with soem good features.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to configure. I use these as a secondary router to firewall my business computers from a home network. Good value with the features you'd expect from a home router. Very easy to setup for the novice.
customer_reviews.author: B. London

customer_reviews.title: Excellent add on wifi
customer_reviews.text: Our incoming broadband connection is in an upstairs bedroom, so downstairs wifi had always been an issue. I connected this to my router using powerlink adaptors and now I have a lovely strong wifi network where once it was weak. Highly recommended if you need to extend wifi coverage.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Craig

customer_reviews.title: Works a treat
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace virgin media super hub 3 as it started to choke with 20+ WiFi devices attached. Works perfect with no issues at all! Had it a while now and can say it’s 1000x better than the super hub
customer_reviews.author: Matt D

customer_reviews.title: yet to get working
customer_reviews.text: tried so many time , but plugged in to a router takes down my network tried as a access point and as an extender , given up haven't got the 3hr sessions it has taken for it to fail each time , spare
customer_reviews.author: otto

customer_reviews.title: Router
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product for the money. I ran this through the house hold wiring and it worked well changed to 75ft cable from the house and I can pick the Wii up from my front room.
customer_reviews.author: lee georgeson

customer_reviews.title: One of if not the best router ive ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: brilliant for gaming and brilliant for installation and very good range aswell....sold my netgear router for this and i won't look back...my online gaming experience has improved massively since purchasing this router.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Good little piece of kit
customer_reviews.text: Does the job - I run in switch mode only, extends my wifi nicely through the ethernet-over-powerline connection (ethernet over powerline is the bottleneck, but good enough for everything really other than large downloads)
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Great router.
customer_reviews.text: Great router, and works well. Easy to set up and their support team responds quickly and most helpful. I had reason to call them about the flashing lights, I wanted them turned off, but you cannot not. A common problem that all the electronic gizmos have flashing lights for some reason, but at night lights ones room up like a Christmas tree! Please manufactures give us option to switch off the lights!
customer_reviews.author: James Buffalo

customer_reviews.title: Best router for your money
customer_reviews.text: Top wireless router at a reasonable price. Has a great range getting rooms through several floors and walls. Very easy set-up apart from the quirk of using 192.168.0.1 instead of the normal 192.168.1.1, Looks classy too. Must have an external internet device to connect to this one and used a fibre-optic compatible one. Achieved speeds around 55mbps download on the network using just the n setting. A great device!
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: router
customer_reviews.text: fast delivery and easy to set up, ideal to extend the internet to cover the dead spots previously experienced with my old router
customer_reviews.author: Mr. M. J. Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Worst WiFi router I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: Just rubbish the wifi signal just keeps dropping. Only wanted it as a wifi hotspot but it not been worth the money
customer_reviews.author: M. Dobson

customer_reviews.title: Low price product with average performance
customer_reviews.text: This device is pretty basic. I guess you get what you pay for. I bought it to replace the wifi feature of a Virgin Superhub 2 which was not great. Lots of positive reviews suggested this device would help. But for me it actually provides worse coverage. Every house is different... but ultimately the clue is in the price. If you need a high-spec device I suggest you skip this product. But if you just need a basic router for a small house or office then it's probably fine.
customer_reviews.author: honestreviewer

product_meta.title: TP-Link Archer AX6000 Next-Gen WiFi 6 Gigabit Dual Band Wireless Cable Router, WiFi Speed up to 4804Mbps/5GHz+1148Mbps/2.4GHz, 8 Gigabit LAN Ports, Ideal for Gaming Xbox/PS4/Steam & 4K/8K Streaming
product_meta.description:
Style Name:New-Gen AX6000 Mbps Gigabit Dual BandThe Archer AX6000 is TP-Link’s first router with Wi-Fi 6 – based on the next generation 802.11ax Wi-Fi technology. Take your Wi-Fi to the next level while being backwards compatible with 802.11a/b/g/n/ac Wi-Fi standards.

-Next-Gen Wi-Fi — 802.11ax
802.11ax (also known as Wi-Fi 6), a next-gen high-efficiency Wi-Fi standard, was created. Now, you can simultaneously connect more devices and enjoy the optimum speed for Gaming, 4K/8K streaming, smart home devices, and AR/VR all compete for network resources.

- 4x Higher Performance
The new Downlink and Uplink MU-MIMO and OFDMA achieve a performance boost 4× that of 802.11ac.

- 3x Faster Speed
1024 QAM and Long OFDM Symbol boost overall speeds up to an incredible 6000 Mbps.

- 4x Larger Capacity
OFDMA greatly increases the number of connected devices by assigning channels to more devices simultaneously.

- Boosted Coverage
Beamforming and RangeBoost technology provide stronger, more reliable connections.

- HomecareTM for Comprehensive Home
Threat Protection Defend your system from malicious threats that can sneak through downloads and file sharing. TP-Link HomeCareTM, powered by Trend MicroTM, protects every device from the latest cyber threats with powerful security, built-in antivirus, and cutting-edge intrusion prevention, comprehensively creating a highly protected smart home environment.

BOX CONTAINS


Next-Generation Wi-Fi 6 Wireless Router Archer AX6000Power adapterRJ45 Ethernet cableQuick installation guide
feature_bullets: Blazing Speed - AX6000 Dual-Band Wi-Fi speed boosted by 1024QAM deliver astonishing wireless speed up to 5952 Mbps: 4804 Mbps (5 GHz) and 1148 Mbps (2.4 GHz)
Ultra Connectivity - 1 × 2.5 Gbps WAN port, 8 × Gigabit LAN ports, and 2 × USB 3.0 in Type A and Type C
Highly Efficient - OFDMA increases average throughput by 4× in high-density scenarios, compared with an 802.11ac standard router. Downlink and uplink MU-MIMO are both supported
Powerful Processing - 1.8 GHz Quad-Core CPU and 2 coprocessors eradicate latency and deliver stable performance
Intelligent Connection - Band Steering directs clients to the less congested band and Airtime Fairness optimizes the time usage
Security System Built-In - TP-Link HomeCareTM provides the whole network with advanced antimalware service powered by Trend MicroTM, delivering Antivirus, Parental Controls and QoS
Easy Setup - Link to your router via Bluetooth and set it up in minutes with the powerful Tether app

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars9,511 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
